revised_title: Hippocampal Synaptic Plasticity and NMDA Receptors: A Role in Information Storage?
tldr: This article discusses the role of hippocampal synaptic plasticity, specifically long-term potentiation (LTP), in information storage and learning. The authors explore the physiological properties of LTP and its potential involvement in learning and memory processes. They also investigate the use of selective antagonists of excitatory amino acid receptors, such as the NMDA receptor antagonist AP5, to study the functional significance of LTP in learning and memory.
